subject: p16848073
Findings: A dual-lead pacemaker/ICD appears unchanged with leads terminating in the right atrium and ventricle, respectively. The heart is normal in size. There is increase in right infrahilar opacity probably correlating with focal right lower lobe opacity. This is superimposed on a probably more chronic interstitial abnormality at the lung bases, which is greater on the right than left. There is no definite pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
Impression: Right lower lobe opacity suggesting pneumonia or aspiration. Suspected moderate interstitial disease at the lung bases. Follow-up radiographs are recommended.
